availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Graves (Green Co farmer and pvt, Hart County, KY prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Isaac C. Graves and Elizabeth Graves. Resident in Green County in 1850. Member of farming family in Green County in 1860. Hart County representative for the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville, Kentucky, in November 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry as private from September 14, 1861, to September 20, 1863. Killed at the battle of Chickamauga on September 20, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 128A and B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 631.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 166.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
